rComments: Clearly writes that lectures aren't mandatory to go to but he makes it worth it. A cool prof that makes you enjoy going to class. DO THE READINGS, it will help you get a good grade. He is clear and fair with the way he marks the exam/midterms and tells you exactly what to look out for. Just 2 midterms and an exam. He also posts the notes online
I highly recommend taking this class with Prof Temelini. Funny and passionate lecturer. Assignments and grading were fair
Legitimately funny dude, 10 grade point sense of humour.

Expectations for tests are very very clear, he's a good teacher but I always felt that students' questions about philosophy were brushed off. It would have been nice to explore philosophy outside of just what's in the books / written on the slides.

He is very nice and friendly, he cares about his students' feeling. You don't have to go to every class because he will post the lecture note on the bright space. He'll do his best to help you get better grades. I highly recommend his class!!!!!!!
he is the best prof among all the pap profs. he is really a nice guy and the content is pretty interesting. get ready to read a lot of materials
I am taking PAP3360 this semester and my final is really soon. I'm finding it really difficult reading for it. Any tips? Does anyone know what he means by 7 keywords talked about through the course?

Temelini is by far the best prof I've had in Public Administration at uOttawa. Great lectures, interesting discussions, and clear expectations. This is also a great class in general. Very heavy on readings, but there is only one very short deliverable, one midterm, and the final.
teacherRatingTags: ['Gives good feedback', 'Amazing lectures ', 'Get ready to read']

rComments: Really enjoyed his class. He is really passionate, and it shows in his lectures. He lectures well and engages the class, and his assignments are short and marking is fair. He's always interested in what you have to say, and is really friendly about answering any questions, even outside of class. There are a LOT of readings, but they're interesting.
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', 'Accessible outside class', 'Gives good feedback']

rComments: He's actually a great prof, always responds to emails quick. Very friendly and caring. The class is super easy, and straightforward. I really liked his class :)
By far one of the best courses in public policy at the University of Ottawa.

His teaching style seems decent at the first few classes, though as the semester goes on he takes on a more rigid style. He does not answer questions in a welcoming way and he views the material as right or wrong, (does not open up to interpretations.) He grades extremely difficult

His class isn't definitely easiest, but he knows the course contents top to bottom. Such a great class so far! Lots of readings and he focuses on the reading comprehension. So if you don't do the readings, then you won't get a good grade. Although his lectures are posted on blackboard, go to classes! You will get a lot out of it.

If you pay attention and write down what he says (which no one did), you'll do well. He puts emphasis (actually says to write it down because it'll be on the midterm) on what is important. You obviously need to read because the course is on the writings on the philosophers. He's a fair marker- he just wants to know that you read the material

Not a very good professor. Boring lectures, confusing slides, jumps between slides. As well in his syllabus he does not tell you what sections he'll be lecturing on, but just tells you that he'll be lecturing on a given text for 2 weeks. That's fine for the first text, but not when you have 2 days to read 250 page books.

Although I struggled with the content at times, I absolutely loved having Mr. Temilini as a prof. He knows his stuff, is funny and is ready to help and answer any questions you may have. Would definitely take another class of his again.
teacherRatingTags: ['Gives good feedback', 'Clear grading criteria', 'Get ready to read']

rComments: Temelini is a nice guy, likes his students, but his material is so confusing and the way that he teaches isn't much help. Tests are hard, his TA's marking is harder, and is abrasive to questions in class. Very unclear grading scheme, would not recommend his course. Doesnt post lecture slides, but his lectures arent much help either. READ THE TEXTS.

He's a good lecturer but having 3x20% exams every two weeks was brutal. The TAs all seemed to mark differently, no consistency, so you just hoped you had one over the other marking your exam. Unless you aren't taking a heavy courseload, I wouldn't recommend this professor because you need to study hardcore to do well in his course.

Really good lecturer and is excels at explaining the material in the books. TA's were hard markers though and were a little unrealistic with expectations . Spend some  quality time studying for the mid-terms.
His lectures are very boring. He also is contradicting and confusing. Class average was terrible. Recommend taking another teacher if you can.

By far the best prof and best class I've had so far. If you're looking for an easy grade not sure if this is your prof. However! he is the most interesting prof! he conveys the material perfectly, he really transports you into the text. His passion for the course material is contagious. I would highly recommend him- just take his course.

Instead of essays for each philospher there is a in class exam composed of multiple choice((8 questions)  and 3-4 short answer and a 4 page essay. The essay section is really easy to ace the short answer and the multiple choice is tricky. Prepare to actually work hard. Apparently he changes his evaluation system each year...

The content of the course can  be hard to understand at first, he is effective in relating the ideas of the text to modern day and  thoroughly explain concepts. He does answer questions in class, but only if they are relevant to what the class will be tested on. Is incredibly flexible with accommodatin students and very approachable. Love him!

Lectures are useless.  He's very hard to get a hold of and not very helpful at all.  Four midterms and that was it.  Marking scheme was confusing and did not make much sense.  Tests were unreasonable.  Avoid if you can.
Alright prof, doesn't respond to in class questions very well but covers the material that is needed. Definitely need to get the assigned books as his exam had reading comprehension questions.

Lectures are very weird. He is abrasive to students asking questions, and tends to highlight things that aren't as important for the study of political philosophy. He calls his grading scheme 'objective' and mathematical, so there should not be any appeals, when there's clearly an opinion section on the rubrik. Take it with Bourgault!
